messageBody:
Hi all,

I am new to jUnit4, so please forgive me these questions.
I want to create a testing framework for a database system.
I use Eclipse so I want to use its build-in jUnit GUI.
It allows only to execute a single testing class or all testing
classes found in a package or a project.

I find some things impossible to do.

1. I have many testing classes in different packages.
2. Each testing class may have its own @Before and @After methods.
3. Some things have to be done for the whole testing class once...
should it be put in a class constructor?
4. I need to create a database environment before all tests from all
clasesses are run.
@BeforeClass seems to be called once at the beginning... but then
@AfterClass is called before other test classes are run.

It looks like, in jUnit4 all testing classes are completely separated
during testing.
Please, explain what is the philosophy of jUnit4 because there are so
few documents on it.

How can I create and run a test suite in Eclipse using its GUI?


Thanks,
KK
